name: Hotel Erzherzog Rainer

reviews.title: Before booking here, make sure you have every cancellation insurance in the book…
reviews.text: This hotel is quick to take your money and gladly, after some reflexion, I'm glad that's all I got to know of this establishment and the people who run it.

We had booked and pre-paid for this place with Booking.com a few months prior to our departure date and we were actually very excited to go stay there after the good reviews I had read on Trip Advisor. Then came our departure date, December 18th 2010. We got the dreaded call that Saturday morning from British airways advising us that our flight was cancelled after the snow and bad weather hitting all of Europe. After hours waiting on the phone and spent on the Internet over a couple of days, tears of frustration and the heartbreak of our extremely well planned holiday flushed down the toilet and our X-Mas plans going to hell, we started looking for plan B. There was just no way possible of making it to Europe with all the airports being clogged up. We simply just couldn't make it. We asked the hotel for a refund and the answer was quite simple: not a chance. The answer was basically that I had booked and whatever happened with the weather wasn't their problem and they don't care and I lose my money. That's all. I tried, the amazing people at booking.com tried, I tried again asking for a response by hotel management and not just an answer from the clerk at the front desk and nothing. No one at "management" even bothered or had the decency to answer me. They simply just ignored my e-mails and didn’t even take the time to answer. I also have to mention that we asked this place to give us a 4 night voucher as we are now planning our trip in July. Refused.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I have to mention that this Erzherhog Rainer place does not represent Austrian businesses. I had pre-paid reservations at the Radisson in Salzburg and they refunded my credit card immediately saying this was an act of God and totally out of my control. I had three hundred euro pre-paid opera tickets and the Opera house went out of their way to resell the tickets and refund me within a 24 hour notice!! They had to send someone at the hotel where the tickets were waiting for me at the front desk!!! That one is amazing to me...
reviews.title: Excellent value, exceptional friendliness

reviews.text: We were also refunded our hotel and ballet tickets in Prague and our train tickets from Rail Europe.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every thing we prepaid on our credit card was refunded because obviously, this situation was completely out of our control and normal decent people could of course understand that and feel empathy towards another human being, but not the people at hotel Erzherzog Rainer in Vienna.
reviews.title: Could Do in a Pinch
This hotel can not be trusted!
reviews.text: We made a reservation well in advance for the easter holiday. Shortly before our trip we got a e-mail in "the spam" from booking.com that the hotel tried to charge for a night, but that my card failed. I thought something was wrong with my card and immediately changed to another card and wrote to the hotel. They replied that my other card also failed! We exchanged e-mails with them a few times and explained that both cards was valid and had been used recently. I checked with the bank and it was all fine. In their last e-mail they had a very very rude tone and told me that they were not to blame. We immediately cancelled the reservation and booked with the hotel next door, Hotel Papageno. We also made a direct payment with one of the same cards that Erzherzog Rainer said had failed...This hotel can not be trusted and they should check their routines! By the way, Hotel Papageno was brilliant and cheaper as well...
stayed at hotel for vienna weekend great place
reviews.title: dont miss

reviews.text: nice people - accommodating frontdesk
reviews.title: Charm and intimacy, but old-fashioned

reviews.text: clean rooms - free hispeed wifi
reviews.title: Excellent service and value for money

reviews.text: 2 mins to ubahn
reviews.title: Charming hotel, excellent value!
Dont think having a confirmation letter in your hand means you've got a room!
reviews.text: We (party of 6 in 3 rooms) booked this hotel in April 2010 for a 5 night stay over new year 2011. One month prior to our departure I reconfirmed with them our reservation - a copy of which I took on our travels. We arrived at the hotel and produced our paper work only to be told they had no room for us and they had booked us into another hotel 100metres away. They apologised and insisted there had been a computer error and there was nothing they could do except help us carry our bags down the road to Johann Strauss Hotel!

Needless to say we were disappointed and unhappy! The next morning my husband returned to the hotel and spoke with the manager - he apologised some more and in recompense he bought us 6 tickets for the New Years Eve concert. This cost the hotel some 300 euro and went some way towards making amends.
reviews.title: Schick and charm

reviews.text: So really I cant rate the hotels facilities but there actions perhaps speak for themselves.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's the wonderful hotel with clean, spacefull rooms and excellent kindly staff. We had answer for every question and it were really very nice and comfortable stay. The breakfast was good, except of one day when it seemed to us that sausages didn't smell good... But every day there were 5-6 cheeses, 4-5 ham, eggs, yogurts, fruits, juices and so on. The restoran was also good but the main wellness of the hotel is not a food but it's own charm and it's excellent staff. Our comfort double room was very good, comfortable beds, good lighted space, nice bathroom. We booked the room in the site of schickhotels group, it was easy and quickly. The only one- it was some problem with authorization of credit card and the manager told us they will keep our room without authorization almost in some days we saw that the hotel frosted one day rate in the card.. We liked our stay very much, for sure we'll come once more :)
reviews.title: Splendid Erzherzog

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, good location, many good thing about this hotel I can say. I am a hard person to impress, but it is a good 4* hotel with unique spirit. Loved the style of the hotel (!!!) as you can feel old Vienna in it.
reviews.title: Made to feel very welcome by all staff, right from our arrival. Short walk from undergrounds and city centre

reviews.text: The Erzherzog Rainer is in a great location; around 15 mins walk from Karlsplatz, and about 5 mins by tram, which stops almost outside the door of the hotel. The hotel is under 10 mins from the Naschmarkt which is full of great ( and very affordable) restaurants and bars. My room was fairly basic but very comfortable; my only gripe being the lack of English language TV channels.
reviews.title: Great Location and Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, highly recommended for a short break.
reviews.title: Charming hotel with courteous, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was excellent in all respects. The room was extremely comfortable and the desk staff very courteous and helpful, advising on sightseeing and even going out of their way to solve the problem of noisy workmen in the street! Breakfasts were great. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed for renovation works, however there are numerous eating establishments in the area. The location is perfect too as you can walk to Karlsplatz in five minutes, pick up the tram almost outside; it runs up to the Museum Quarter and on to the canal and fun fair areas or use the underground which is two minutes walk away to reach many of the other sights. We would definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: If you want to feel real Vienna , stay at Hotel Erzherzog Rainer!

reviews.text: We are from Canada and stayed in hotel for 4 days. We wrote e-mail prior to arriving and we got exactly what we wanted- quite room on the 5th floor. We were very happy to be there. Excellent location, tasty breakfast, very clean. Many many thanks to all people who work in this hotel, we got answers from the front desk staff to every single question. Once we even asked about weather forecast, gentlemen at the front desk immediately took his Blackberry and told us what is expected. You feel there like at home. If you want to feel real Vienna , stay at Hotel Erzherzog Rainer, you will not be disappointed at all!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice small hotel near Karlsplatz, well connected by metro (Taubstummengasse station is only 100 meters away). Very helpful staff, nice and clean rooms. Good breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: A Good Compromise

description: Tradition, Viennese charm and outstanding Austrian hospitality all await guests to the 4-star Hotel Erzherzog Rainer. The 84 rooms in Wilhelminian style are continually modernized without compromising the hotel's character. The central, convenient location not far from the Vienna State Opera guarantees a vacation in which there's opportunity to immerse oneself deep in the Viennese soul. Upscale Viennese "Gasthaus" cuisine is celebrated at the restaurant "Wiener Wirtschaft".
